basic_info.description_header: Currently going through Code Fellows software development program. Great at working with a team and not afraid to bring ideas to the table and pointing out possible corrections to increase team efficiency.
basic_info.description: Before I decided to change careers I was a sophomore student attending Stony Brook University in New York majoring in astrophysics. I also worked part-time at a Lowes. I decided to learn software development because coding has always been something that has piqued my interest but I have been and still am fascinated with the science of the universe. I chose this specific skill because my aunt is a back end coder and I have always preferred working with a team out of reach of public interaction so I decided that learning coding and becoming a back end software developer wouldn't be such a bad career. I would prefer to be a back end coder simply because it interests me and also because I would like to strive for a position that works more with behind-the-scenes work. My prior experience at Code Fellows makes me feel more than confident in my new career in tech and I am more than proud in my capabilities. Even so, I will still continue to improve in anyway I can and am open to any suggestions or opinions. I am not fond of limiting myself by feeling I have reached a level of comfortability. To improve every day and be better than I was the day prior is the goal.

projects.title: Flash-Flip
projects.description: The first project I worked on with a team and it allows a user to create custom decks of flashcards and use them to study

projects.title: Horned Beast
projects.description: A project that allowed a user to be able to choose which images they liked the most and they could do this by liking the image.
